metadata.title: CVE-2023-52516 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:dma-debug: don't call __dma_entry_alloc_check_leak() underfree_entries_lock __dma_entry_alloc_check_leak() calls into printk ->serial console output (qcom geni) and grabs port->lock underfree_entries_lock spin lock, which is a reverse locking dependency chain asqcom_geni IRQ handler can call into dma-debug code and grabfree_entries_lock under port->lock. Move __dma_entry_alloc_check_leak()call out of free_entries_lock scope so that we don't acquire serialconsole's port->lock under it. Trimmed-down lockdep splat: The existingdependency chain (in reverse order) is: -> #2(free_entries_lock){-.-.}-{2:2}: _raw_spin_lock_irqsave+0x60/0x80dma_entry_alloc+0x38/0x110 debug_dma_map_page+0x60/0xf8dma_map_page_attrs+0x1e0/0x230 dma_map_single_attrs.constprop.0+0x6c/0xc8geni_se_rx_dma_prep+0x40/0xcc qcom_geni_serial_isr+0x310/0x510__handle_irq_event_percpu+0x110/0x244
